Back to Franz Liszt

Franz Liszt

Dritter Mephisto-Walzer, S. 216

1883 · LW A325 · R. 38

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP]

Liszt originally wrote the Dritter Mephisto-Walzer (S. 216; LW A325; R. 38) for piano. It also exists in an earlier, unpublished version (S. 215a) that most obviously differs in its shorter length; a further, intermediate version (S. 215b) also exists.

Liszt later made an arrangement for piano duet (S. 615a; LW B58) and, in one of the manuscripts, gave indications for a potential orchestral arrangement (S. 808).

Recommended editions

  • New Liszt Edition (Editio Musica Budapest) · I/14 · Z. A/B 8858 · Dances, Marches and Scherzos II · ed. Imre Mező / Imre Sulyok
  • Editio Musica Budapest · Z. 13951 · ed. Imre Mező / Imre Sulyok

Duration: 10'

Difficulty: 3.5
